=INSTALLATION=
----
==ROS-Industrial Software Installation==
All of the following ROS Industrial software must be installed.
  # ROS Install - The instructions for installing ROS can be found here:
    * [http://www.ros.org/wiki/electric/Installation/Ubuntu Electric ]
    * [http://www.ros.org/wiki/electric/Installation/Ubuntu Fuerte(Beta)]
  # PR2 Desktop - Some required libraries are not installed with the basic ROS install.  The instructions for installing the PR2 Desktop can be found here:
    * [http://www.ros.org/wiki/Robots/PR2/electric Electric].
    * [http://www.ros.org/wiki/Robots/PR2/electric Feurte(Beta)].

  # Currently, ROS-Industrial can only be downloaded and installed from source.  
    # Download the desired repository version:
      * Collision avoidance demo video release: [https://swri-ros-pkg.googlecode.com/svn/tags/ros_org_video_rc1]
      * Electric branch:  [http://code.google.com/p/swri-ros-pkg/source/browse/#svn%2Fbranches%2Felectric]
      * Fuerte (recommended for latest functionality): [http://code.google.com/p/swri-ros-pkg/source/browse/#svn%2Ftrunk]
    # Add the ROS-Industrial stack location to the ROS_PACKAGE_PATH system variable.
    # Run "rosmake" from the industrial stack directory.  The source should build with no errors.

==Industrial Robot Controller Installation==
Enabling ROS-Industrial control of a specific robot requires corresponding installations on the robot controller.
  * [http://www.ros.org/wiki/dx100/Tutorials/Creating_DX100_Server_Application Motoman DX100]
